required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine (7.5μg/0.25ml)
clinical_study.official_title: Open Phase I and Randomized, Double-blind, Controlled Phase III Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine in Healthy Subjects Aged 6-35 Months

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of quadrivalent influenza vaccine in healthy children aged 6-35 months.

detailed_description.textblock: The study includes open-labelled phase I and randomized, double-blind, controlled phase III clinical trial. In the phase I, 20 healthy Chinese children aged 6-35 months were administered with two doses of QIV (7.5μg/0.25ml). In the phase Ⅲ clinical trial, 2320 children were assigned to QIV group, TIV (B/Victoria) group and TIV (B/Yamagata) group in a 2:1:1 ratio. All vaccines were manufactured by Sinovac Biotech Co., Ltd.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The phase Ⅰ clinical trial was a single arm.The phase Ⅲ was 3 parallel arms.

primary_outcome.measure: The lower limit of 95% confidence intervals (95%CI) of geometric mean titer (GMT) ratio (experimental group/control group) of hemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibody titer≥2/3.
primary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity index, One of the standard to evaluate the experimental vaccine is non-inferior to the control vaccines.

primary_outcome.measure: The lower limit of 95% CI of the seroconversion rate difference (experimental group-control group)≥-10%.
primary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity index, Another standard to evaluate the experimental vaccine is non-inferior to the control vaccines.

secondary_outcome.measure: The lower limit of 95%CI of the ratio of GMT (experimental group/control group) >1.5.
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity index, One of the standard to evaluate the experimental vaccine is superior to the control vaccines for specific antigen type.

secondary_outcome.measure: The lower limit of 95% CI of the difference of HI antibody seroconversion rate (experimental group-control group)>10%
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity index, Another standard to evaluate the experimental vaccine is superior to the control vaccines for specific antigen type.

secondary_outcome.measure: The lower limit of 95% CI of seroconversion rate for each HI antibody after two doses immunization≥40%.
The seroprotective rate (HI antibody titer≥1:40) of each HI antibody after two doses immunization≥70%.
The geometric mean increase (GMI) of each HI antibody after two doses immunization >2.5.
The lower limit of 95%CI of the ratio of GMT(experimental group/control group)≥2/3, in the subjects whose pre-immune HI antibody titer<1:40
The lower limit of 95% CI of the difference of HI antibody seroconversion rate (experimental group-control group)≥-10%, in the subjects whose pre-immune HI antibody titer<1:40.
The incidence of the solicited local and general adverse reactions 0-7 days after each immunization.
secondary_outcome.description: Safety index, The adverse reactions refers to the adverse events which were considered related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of the unsolicited adverse events 0-28 days after each immunization
The incidence of the serious adverse events within 7 months after the first immunization.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 months after the first dose immunization

intervention.description: One dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine: 0.25 ml per dose containing 7.5μg antigen.
One dose of quadrivalent influenza vaccine: 0.25 ml per dose containing 7.5μg antigen.
One dose of trivalent influenza vaccine (contains B/Victoria strain): 0.25 ml per dose containing 7.5μg antigen.
One dose of trivalent influenza vaccine (contains B/Yamagata strain): 0.25 ml per dose containing 7.5μg antigen.

overall_official.affiliation: Jiangsu Provincial Center for Disease Prevention and Control

facility.name: Guanyun Center for Disease Prevention and Control
Pizhou Center for Disease Prevention and Control
